roms.name: atari2600
roms.Description: The Atari 2600 was a home video game console released by Atari in 1977

roms.name: atari5200
roms.Description: Atari released a series of 8 bit computers (400, 800, 1200XL, 600XL, 800XL, 130XE, 65XE, 800XE, and XEGS) and a video game console known as the Atari 5200 from 1979 to 1992

roms.name: atari7800
roms.Description: The Atari 7800 was a video game console released by Atari in 1986.

roms.name: atari800
roms.Description: Atari released a series of 8 bit computers (400, 800, 1200XL, 600XL, 800XL, 130XE, 65XE, 800XE, and XEGS) and a video game console known as the Atari 5200 from 1979 to 1992

roms.name: atarilynx
roms.Description: The Atari Lynx is the world's first handheld gaming console with a color screen. It was released by Atari in 1989

roms.name: fba
roms.Description: Final Burn Alpha is a Multiple Arcade Emulator most popular for emulating Neo-Geo, Capcom, Konami, and Cave games. It is developed by the final burn team and originated from FinalBurn by Dave

roms.name: fds
roms.Description: The Family Computer Disk System a.k.a. Famicom Disk System was released in Japan in 1986. It is an addon to the Famicom and used floppy disks.

roms.name: gamegear
roms.Description: The Sega Game Gear was an 8 bit handheld gaming console released in 1990

roms.name: gb
roms.Description: The Game Boy was released by Nintendo in 1989 thus kicking off the era of handheld gaming and Pokemon.

roms.name: gba
roms.Description: The Game Boy Advance is a 32 bit handheld video game console released by Nintendo in 2001.

roms.name: gbc
roms.Description: The Game Boy Color was an 8 bit handheld gaming console released by Nintendo in 1998. Pokemon Yellow anyone?

roms.name: genesis
roms.Description: This console, known as the Mega Drive everywhere except in the USA where it was renamed Genesis, was released by Sega in 1988

roms.name: mame-mame4all
roms.Description: MAME stands for Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator. MAME can emulate thousands of games that otherwise would have been lost in the ash-heaps of history.

roms.name: mastersystem
roms.Description: The Sega Master System was a 4th generation video game console released by Sega in 1987.

roms.name: megadrive
roms.Description: The Sega Master System was a 4th generation video game console released by Sega in 1987.

roms.name: n64
roms.Description: The Nintendo 64 is a 5th generation gaming console released by Nintendo in 1996

roms.name: neogeo
roms.Description: The Neo Geo is a cartridge-based arcade system board and home video game console released by SNK in 1990.

roms.name: nes
roms.Description: The Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) is an 8-bit home video game console that was released by Nintendo in 1985. This console officially ended the video game crash of 1983-1984.

roms.name: ngp
roms.Description: The Neo Geo Pocket was a handheld video game system released by SNK in 1998.

roms.name: ngpc
roms.Description: The Neo Geo Pocket Color was a handheld video game system released by SNK in 1999.

roms.name: psx
roms.Description: The PlayStation 1 is a 5th generation video game console released by Sony in 1994.

roms.name: sega32x
roms.Description: The Sega 32X was released as an add-on for the Sega Genesis in 1994. There was a whopping total of 40 games for this console- it was considered a commercial failure.

roms.name: snes
roms.Description: The Super Nintendo Entertainment System (or SNES) was a 4th generation video game console released by Nintendo in 1991. It is one of the most popular consoles.

roms.name: zxspectrum
roms.Description: The ZX Spectrum was an 8 bit series of home computers released by Sinclair Research in 1982.
